The claim made by Gov: Rick Scott that the Medicaid expansion would cost Florida $1.9 billion a year.
The oversimplified estimate used by Gov: Scott, which relied on assumptions and ignored the actual implementation of the Medicaid expansion.
The discrepancy in the quoted number: as Gov. Scott's own Agency for Health Care Administration provided a different estimate.
The details of the Medicaid program: including its voluntary nature for states and the financial terms offered by the federal government.
